Broad-leaved forest, e.g.,
Fagus
,
Fraxinus
, orchards, shrubland, grassland, gardens, occasionally coniferous forests. From 400–480 m a.s.l. in Switzerland . Most finds are from synanthropic sites.

Probably introduced to the northern part of its distribution area. Tajovský (1996) described the life cycle of
M. voigti
in a suburban forest in South Bohemia .
